task.title: Minimize View
task.shortdesc: Minimize a view within the Session Editor window.

taskbody.context: From the Session Editor or an undocked view:

step.cmd: Click the minimize/_ button near the top right corner of the view.
step.stepresult: A small title bar for that view will appear at an edge of the Session Editor.

step.cmd: To make a minimized view temporarily reappear, click on its name or icon.
step.stepresult: When the focus is changed to another view (i.e. another view is selected), the view will return to its minimized position. To make the view retain its opened position when focus is lost, click the thumbtack button near the top right corner of the title bar. To deactivate this option, click the thumbtack again.

step.cmd: To restore the minimized view to a normal position within the Session Editor frame, click the restore button near the top right corner (this button looks like two windows), or press CTRL+N when the view is in focus.
step.stepresult: The view will return to its previous docked position in the Session Editor, even if it was undocked when you minimized it.
